\/D:\/repos\/rr\/source\/manual\/particl: <g1>Initializers</g1> control the states of particles such as position, velocity, size, and so on when the particles are first spawned.
<g1>Initializers</g1> control the states of particles such as position, velocity, size, and so on when the particles are first spawned.
They have no effect on particles spawned on previous frames.
They have no effect on particles spawned on previous frames.
Some <g1>updaters</g1> act change the particle's value at the <g2>end</g2> of the frame.
Some <g1>updaters</g1> act change the particle's value at the <g2>end</g2> of the frame.
They effectively overwrite any initial values set by a similar initializer.
They effectively overwrite any initial values set by a similar initializer.
Such is the case with all animations.
Such is the case with all animations.
They operate on the particle's lifetime and a color animation updater will overwrite any initial values from a color initializer.
They operate on the particle's lifetime and a color animation updater will overwrite any initial values from a color initializer.
Similarly, initializers which operate on the same field are exclusive and only the bottom one will have any effect, since they are executed in order.
Similarly, initializers which operate on the same field are exclusive and only the bottom one will have any effect, since they are executed in order.
For example if you assign two color initializer, only the second one will have any effect.]
For example if you assign two color initializer, only the second one will have any effect.]
Several properties are common across many initializers.
Several properties are common across many initializers.

Inherit the particle system component position, as defined in the particle entity's Transform component
Inherit the particle system component position, as defined in the particle entity's Transform component
If it inherits the parent position, this is applied on top of the inherited position.
If it inherits the parent position, this is applied on top of the inherited position.
Inherit the particle system component's rotation, as defined in the Transform component
Inherit the particle system component's rotation, as defined in the Transform component
If it inherits the parent's rotation, this is applied on top of the inherited rotation.
If it inherits the parent's rotation, this is applied on top of the inherited rotation.
Inherit the particle system component's uniform scale, as defined in the Transform component
Inherit the particle system component's uniform scale, as defined in the Transform component
If it inherits the parent's scale, this is applied on top of the inherited scale.
If it inherits the parent's scale, this is applied on top of the inherited scale.
For example, a velocity initializer can change its direction depending on the parent's rotation or decide to ignore it and always shoot particles in a fixed direction.
For example, a velocity initializer can change its direction depending on the parent's rotation or decide to ignore it and always shoot particles in a fixed direction.
On the other hand, size initializers don't change based on the parent's rotation, so the rotation fields won't appear at all.
On the other hand, size initializers don't change based on the parent's rotation, so the rotation fields won't appear at all.
Particles are spawned in an axis-aligned bounding box, defined by its left lower back corner and its right upper front corner.

Initial size sets the particle's uniform size when it's spawned for the first time.

Initial 3D orientation sets the orientation for 3D-aware particles when they first spawn.

The arc position initializer positions the particles in an arc (or a straight line if the arc's height is 0) between two point, the emitter's position and a target transform component.

If checked, new particles will appear in order from the emitter towards the target.
